bug.author: mwalenia
bug.summary: ImportError: No module named tfx.examples.chicago_taxi.trainer on Dataflow
bug.description:
I'm trying to run the Chicago Taxi Example on Google Dataflow and I ran into a problem with imports. After setting PYTHONPATH env in order to make the python files run on my environment, the pipelines fail with <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/dataflow_worker/batchworker.py", line 766, in run self._load_main_session(self.local_staging_directory) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/dataflow_worker/batchworker.py", line 482, in _load_main_session pickler.load_session(session_file) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/apache_beam/internal/pickler.py", line 269, in load_session return dill.load_session(file_path) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/dill/_dill.py", line 410, in load_session module = unpickler.load() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/pickle.py", line 864, in load dispatch[key](self) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/pickle.py", line 1139, in load_reduce value = func(*args) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/dill/_dill.py", line 828, in _import_module return getattr(__import__(module, None, None, [obj]), obj) ImportError: No module named tfx.examples.chicago_taxi.trainer </denchmark-code>
I don't know how to remedy this - is it possible to set an environmental variable in a Dataflow pipeline?

comments.comment: Quick update: I've been able to recreate the problem but haven't yet found the fix.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/krazyhaas>@krazyhaas</denchmark-link> can you take a look at my PR? I believe I managed to fix this
Thanks for the PR! Iâ€™ll check it out tomorrow.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mwalenia>@mwalenia</denchmark-link> Line: is giving <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "trainer/task.py", line 25, in <module> from tfx.examples.chicago_taxi.trainer import model ImportError: No module named tfx.examples.chicago_taxi.trainer </denchmark-code>
